body.p: A Kentucky attorney, politician, and jurist. Graduated at Emory and Henry College in 1841. Studied law and admitted to the bar in 1843. Practiced law in Prestonsburg, Kentucky. Married to Sarah Janes Smith Elliott. Member of the Democratic Party. Owned three enslaved persons in 1860. Served as a member of the Kentucky House of Representatives in 1847 and 1861. Served the Sixth Congressional District of Kentucky as a member of the United States House of Representative from 1853 to 1859. Indicted for treason in 1861. Served as a private in the 5th Kentucky Infantry of the Confederates States Army in 1862. Served as a delegate to the Provisional Confederate Congress in 1862. Served the Twelfth Congressional District as a member of the First and Second Confederate Congresses in the House of Representatives from 1862 to 1865.
